phrases.p2_english: Discuss the young disciple's first few days as a Christian.
phrases.p3_english: Share "letter to God." If the new disciple has not had a chance to write one, encourage him/her to do so.
phrases.p7_english: Review how to become a disciple.
phrases.p8_english: Reinforce the joy of salvation and awe of God.
phrases.p9_english: Devoted to the Apostles' Teaching — the Word
phrases.p10_english: For a quiet time, suggest a book or theme — reading a chapter a day.
phrases.p11_english: For many, a quiet time journal is helpful.
phrases.p13_english: Discuss the purpose of each gathering:  Sunday Worship Services, Midweek Services — Men's Night Out / Women's Night Out, Bible Talks, Devotionals and discipleship partners.
phrases.p14_english: Discuss the need to initiate relationships — to give, not just receive.
phrases.p15_english: Discuss the importance of hospitality — invite people into your home for a meal.
phrases.p16_english: Discuss the leadership's expectation to tithe on Sundays and give a benevolent offering at the Midweek Services.  Read together
phrases.p24_english: Discuss the purpose of bread and fruit of the vine.
phrases.p25_english: Discuss what it means to become spiritually "weak, sick and fallen asleep." How does communion prevent these conditions? (sick:
phrases.p36_english: With whom have you shared your faith?
phrases.p37_english: List friends and family to share with this week.
phrases.p42_english: Strive to learn the first principles (elementary teachings) and go on to maturity, so you can be fruitful and not fall away.
phrases.p43_english: Discuss taking the First Principles Classes.
